H0.text: Desert is a place characterized by high average daily temperature and heavy annual precipitation.

H1.text: Grassland has high average daily temperature and heavy annual precipitation.

H2.text: Rainforest is the place where high average daily temperature and heavy annual precipitation are found.

H3.text: The tundra is a region where high average daily temperature and heavy annual precipitation are found.

A4.text: Tropical rainforests are characterized by a warm and wet climate with no substantial dry season: typically found within 10 degrees north and south of the equator. Mean monthly temperatures exceed 18 °C (64 °F) during all months of the year.

A5.text: Finally, these soils are poor due to the high volume of rain in tropical rainforests washes nutrients out of the soil more quickly than in other climates.
